channel.title: Help me
channel.description: I need to get a present for my grandparents so Im upgrading there old Dell Computer. I want to reuse the old Pentium 4 Prescott HT 2.8 GHZ Processor, the 80 GB IDE HARDDRIVE, and the CD/DVD player. We are on a least spent possible basis. Please recommend me a case, motherboard, ram, videocard, psu. fan. I prefer tigerdirect and newegg. REP++ for the one who can find me the best deal. Im looking at 300 right now. Please go lower.

item.title: Help me
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You are going to build a whole new computer but want to keep the crappy P4 cpu? Why exactly? Especially when you can get a good CPU for $100 or less.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:11, topic:249477”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=328800.msg2572631#msg2572631 date=1228774018]
What do your Grandparents do?
My Mum can’t even work a computer, and my Grandma has no idea what a computer is.

They’re not worrying about Huge HD Moniters.
[/quote]

My dad can’t even close a fucking window! He asks me how to close it, again and again! He’s like: how do you close it? I say press the X in the corner, and then he asks that one? For some reason he calls IE Internet Exployer, and a complete reinstall of an OS a restart. A while ago our pc was fucked up, and I had no idea how to fix it (it was about 4 years ago, at that time I knew nothing about pc’s) and the guy from a callcenter said to format it. So he was like do i hef to reboot??//?

(small rage about the ignorance of my father towards computers)[/quote]

I told my mum, she lol’d she doesn’t know squat about pc’s but i think she knows more than your dad.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Email, but we are going to do dual monitors because my grandparents want a big screen. When I go up there I want to be able to play video games on the computer. The shitty mobo they got now only supports a pci card. I don’t know the wattage. Its dell dimension e130.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 07, 2008, 08:31:58 pm[/size][hr][quote=“chrisn2323, post:3, topic:249477”]just upgrade the ram and videocard. if you need to, upgrade the psu

what type of ram and vcard does your mobo support?[/quote]

Unless you can find a video card that is a good pci one then I need a new mobo.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 07, 2008, 08:33:29 pm[/size][hr]Correction its a 310[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 07, 2008, 08:37:12 pm[/size][hr]This is the system requirenments for the game I want to play.

Minimum  	                  Recommended

CPU Pentium 3, 800 Mhz Pentium 4, 2.0 Ghz
RAM 512 MB or better 512 MB or better
Graphics Radeon 8500LE, Geforce
MX400 or better FX5700 / ATI 9200
OS Windows ME / 2000 / XP Windows 2000 / XP
ISP DSL Cable / T1
Network Card 10 Mbps 100 Mbps / 1000 Mbps
Preferred: Killer NIC
Hard Drive 900 MB 900 MB[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 07, 2008, 08:58:27 pm[/size][hr]The monitor im getting UNG toc t240hd rose-black 24" 5ms HDMI Widescreen HDTV Montior 300cd/m2 SC 10000:1 Built in DTV tunder & dolby Digital surround sound.
